Class BoundedDomainUi<T extends net.tangly.core.domain.BoundedDomain<?,?,?>>

java.lang.Object
net.tangly.ui.app.domain.BoundedDomainUi<T>
All Implemented Interfaces:
Flow.Subscriber<Object>, net.tangly.core.domain.BoundedDomain.EventListener
public abstract class BoundedDomainUi<T extends net.tangly.core.domain.BoundedDomain<?,?,?>> extends Object implements net.tangly.core.domain.BoundedDomain.EventListener
Define the interface for the visualization of a bounded domain. The user interface is a set of views to display entities, commands, and dialogs to modify entities.

Commands can trigger domain changes which should be reflected in the user interface. Some commands update the current displayed view, others update multiple views of the domain interface.

    • addAdministration

      protected void addAdministration(@NotNull @NotNull com.vaadin.flow.component.applayout.AppLayout layout, @NotNull @NotNull com.vaadin.flow.component.contextmenu.SubMenu subMenu, @NotNull @NotNull net.tangly.commons.lang.functional.LazyReference<?> domainView)
      The administration menu provides a standard administration operation for a bounded domain.
      • Provides statistics about entities of the domain.
      • Import domain entities from a set of TSV files stored in a directory. The command is responsible for a semantic meaningful ordering of the imports.
      • Export domain entities to a set of TSV files stored in a directory. Existing files are overwritten. The exported entities could later be imported into the application with the import domain command.
      Parameters:
      layout - layout in which the view will be displayed
      subMenu - menu to which the administration commands are added
      domainView - view to be displayed when the statistics command is selected
